posts.cooked: Hey, Mateo from 3324 again. Our team has recently been working on a template code for just a drivetrain, meant to be as simple as possible. We were discouraged when looking for code examples other than YAGSL , so we decided to create a simple one. Code can be found at: GitHub - metrobots/25-drivetrainOnly . We are also looking for the community’s help fixing any errors, so if you find anything, please feel free to reply in thread or create a pull request! This is meant to be a basic, somewhat beginner-level implementation.
You may want to seed your relative encoder with the absolute encoder bc sometimes the absolute encoders are unreliable due to various electrical failuress.
What do you mean “seed”? Sorry, I’m just not familiar with that term
Set the relative encoder position to the absolute encoder position
Ah, you mean within the module.java file? Just periodically make sure the values haven’t desynced?

posts.name: David Racovan
posts.cooked:
It’s typically recommended to set your relative encoder to your absolute encoder’s position at startup , then use that value during operation; this will usually get you faster response times from your sensor, and protect against failures on your absolute encoder midmatch.

note: you may want to implement some function to seed sensor values a few seconds after boot, since some sensors are not accessible or provide bogus values while the RIO is booting
And this would all be in module.java or drivetrain.java correct?
Its your code, you should do it how you want
I think I’ve made the suggested changes!
